thread.title: Thursday's roundup | Oscar Smith defense halts Hickory
thread.title_full: Thursday's roundup | Oscar Smith defense halts Hickory | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: Jami Frankenberry
title: Thursday's roundup | Oscar Smith defense halts Hickory
text:
No. 2 Oscar Smith 20, Hickory 3 Kourtney Johnson rushed for two scores, Shon Mitchell threw a touchdown pass and the Tigers (4-0) shook off a slow start and pulled away from the visiting Hawks (1-4).
Johnson's 15-yard scoring run staked Oscar Smith to a 7-3 halftime lead.
Hickory held the Tigers to just three first downs and 57 yards of total offense in the first half.
The second half was a different story as the Tigers outgained the Hawks 225 to 8.
Shon Mitchell threw a 29-yard strike to Josh Gray in the third quarter.
Johnson scored from 10 yards out in the fourth quarter. He finished with 126 yards.
- Reported by Charlie Baumgardner
No. 8 Salem 14, Green Run 0
Malik Butts' 3-yard rushing touchdown with 5:20 remaining in the second quarter was all the SunDevils (4-1) needed against the visiting Stallions (1-5).
Butts carried the ball for 55 yards on the night.
Salem's Davonte Williams scored the insurance touchdown on 50-yard run.
Williams had 17 carries for 106 yards.
Green Run's Brelynd Cyphers had 32 rushes for 104 yards.
- Reported by Gary Lassiter
No. 3 Lake Taylor 57, Granby 14
Dazmine Palmer rushed for 309 yards and three touchdowns to lead the Titans (5-0) past the Comets (2-3) at Powhatan Field.
Palmer opened the scoring with a 63-yard score in the first quarter. He added TD runs of 3 and 31 yards.
Wayne Davis returned two interceptions for touchdowns, including a 90-yarder.
Granby's Keyshawn Brown had rushing TDs in the first and fourth quarters.
Key stats: LT-Palmer 23-309, 3 TDs rushing; Tyrek Hughey 2-5-46-0, TD passing; G-Keyshawn Brown 5-9-78-1 passing; 8-17, 2 TDs rushing.
